channel.description: OK Boomer, all the latest TikToks from trashpanda.draws

item.title: Necks! Warmups are the same as yesterday. Make sure you’re drawing heads on the necks we want to be able to connect the forms. Draw the traps in. If you can draw the collarbone on the torso and you can draw it on the neck then you can draw a neck on the
item.description: Necks! Warmups are the same as yesterday. Make sure you’re drawing heads on the necks we want to be able to connect the forms. Draw the traps in. If you can draw the collarbone on the torso and you can draw it on the neck then you can draw a neck on the

item.title: Day, 215 done! Today was all about arms, more specifically the forearm. Understanding how the forearm connects and how it twists and how all of those muscles work can be a little bit tricky. But I think I have a much better understanding of all of it all

item.title: Day 220 done! Today was some good experimenting with getting the lips properly drawn, wrapped around the teeth on an open jaw. And getting the jaw swung back properly. I know, depending on like your bite the way the jaw swings back can very drastically be
item.description: Day 220 done! Today was some good experimenting with getting the lips properly drawn, wrapped around the teeth on an open jaw. And getting the jaw swung back properly. I know, depending on like your bite the way the jaw swings back can very drastically be

item.title: Figure drawing instead of portraits because we’re focusing on the face today. Mouth, Teeth, Lips! Pay attention to how things curve and are foreshortened because of it. The jaw is a hinge and remember when the mouth is open the lips get stretched across
item.description: Figure drawing instead of portraits because we’re focusing on the face today. Mouth, Teeth, Lips! Pay attention to how things curve and are foreshortened because of it. The jaw is a hinge and remember when the mouth is open the lips get stretched across

item.title: Short face studies are back! Different body types. You kinda off have to learn to be conscious of asking variation into your drawings when it comes to drawing different body types and different facial features. Use reference build up your visual library
item.description: Short face studies are back! Different body types. You kinda off have to learn to be conscious of asking variation into your drawings when it comes to drawing different body types and different facial features. Use reference build up your visual library

item.title: Day 223 done! Today was intro to perspective. Because I shamefully have neglected this topic for 222 days. And I say shamefully because I know for a fact that if I was better at understanding perspective, I would be better at drawing characters in perspec
